Kavirajamarga and Literature

Amoghavarsha was a great scholar and a peace-loving king. He authored the earliest available poetic work in Kannada, 'Kavirajamarga'. He also composed 'Prashnottara Ratnamalika' in Sanskrit. He is often referred to as the 'Ashoka of the South'.

ЁЯПЩя╕П
Founding of Manyakheta

He founded the city of Manyakheta (Malkhed) and made it the permanent capital of the Rashtrakutas. This city was renowned for its grandeur.

тШ╕я╕П
Religion and Tolerance

He was a follower of Jainism (Acharya Jinasena was his guru), but he was tolerant towards all religions. As a devotee of Mahalakshmi, he once sacrificed his finger to the goddess to save his subjects from calamity.

ЁЯЪв
Account of Sulaiman

The Arab traveler Sulaiman visited India during Amoghavarsha's reign and described the Rashtrakuta Empire as one of the 'four great empires of the world' (along with China, Rome, and Baghdad).
